4427942/4359624/4462008.title: Pain in the Head
4427942/4359624/4462008.text:
Years ago some people suffered from very violent headache. It recurred pretty often and caused them great suffering and worry. However they never dreamt of going to a doctor or account of it. It was believed he had no cure for it. It was believed he has no cure for it, that it was beyond his skill. It was not a thing that a ordinary doctor could cure. I note the patient was brought to "a wise woman" a kind of witch who alone could cure.There were such women in every parish at least. She generally lived alone in a small one roomed collage generally on a mountain side on other barren please. This
(continues on next page)

4463715/4374049/4463753.title: A Cure for a Pain in the Back
4463715/4374049/4463753.text: A pain in the back can be cured in the following way:Get a naggin of turpentine, a naggin of vinegar, and the yolk of four or five eggs and mix them together. Put the mixture into a bottle and leave it aside for a day. Then rub some of it on the back daily and after a few days the pain will go.

4463715/4374069/4463815.title: A Cure for a Pain in the Back
4463715/4374069/4463815.text:
A pain in the back can be cured in the following way: Pull about ten or twleve roots of the dandelion and boil them in a quart and a pint of water for half an hour. Then strain the juice and add a sufficient supply of sugar to sweeten it. Put the juice into bottles and take a wine glassful of it every morning for fifteen morning before breakfast. This treatment was tried by Miss Celia Joyce, Glenavenew who had a pain in her back and it completely cured her.Annie Kate Walsh
(continues on next page)

4427966/4361883/4466896.title: Ringworm
4427966/4361883/4466896.text:
The seventh son of a family has a cure of ring worm. He leaves his hand on the sore and it cures it.



The cure for lumbago is a mustard plaster. Get some mustard or two pieces of swanskin and tie it round the back and it will cure it or or get mjustard and linseed meal and make a poultice of it and put it to the back and it will soon cure it.



The seventh daughter of a family is said to have a cure for a pain in the back. Se she leaves her hand on the back and the pain goes.



This is a cure for worts. If there is a hole in a rock where there is water, and to wash the worts well with it they will soon go. There is another cure for worts that is to steal a bit of meat out of a house to hide it in the dung pu pit and when the meat would be rotten the worts will go.



The cure for a sprained ankle is hold the foot under a water fall and the the swelling will go down. There is another cure for a sprained ankle. Go to the weaver and ask for a sprain
(continues on next page)

When a person has a sore back and when he is not able to work, it can be cured by going to Killmacdugh three miles west of Gort. When a person goes he should lie on a bed where a saint is buried and to roll himself seven times on the bed and it will get cured. The person will not get the pain ever again. There are seven old ruins of Churches and an old tour. The old tour is standing yet but the Churches are gone.Told By: Martin Linnane, Ballinabucky Kilcolgan, Co. Galway.

4649689/4647444/4650882.title: A Cure for the Whooping-Cough
4649689/4647444/4650882.text:
A Cure for the Whooping Cough.The Whooping cough can be cured in the following way:-Get an ass foal, and go out three times under his head, and kiss the cross on his back while doing so say "in the name of the Father, and the Son and the Holy Ghost". After a week the whooping cough will be gone.John Flynn , Gowley. Keshcarrigan, told me the above cure.   9-12-1937 . Annie flynn.A Cure for the back Ache.Mrs John Shanley . borrick, Keshcarrigan, told me the following cure for a back ache.Get a rabbit skin that was killed and preserved in Autumn. Put the furry side to the back and leave it there for a few weeks. This is a common cure for a pain in the back in my locality.Annie Flynn 9-12-1937Gowley.



A Cure for the back Ache.Mrs. John Shanley, Corrick, Keshcarrigan, told me the following cure for a back ache.  Get a rabbit skin that was killed, and preserved in Autumn.  Put the furry side to the back, and leave it there for a few weeks.  This is a common cure for a pain in the back in my locality.Annie Flynn,Gowley.9th.12.1937

4758451/4745089/4759833.title: Cure for a Backache
4758451/4745089/4759833.text:
200Cure for a back-ache.Long ago as the old people were very poor, they had to depend on their own physical sill to cure their sick.I understand from some information I received a few weeks ago. that some of the remedies for certain ailments were made thus: Any person suffering from a back-ache, was brought to the cleverest man in the district, and he made a poultice known as the "Poor Man's Plaster."This poultice consisted of "Burgundy Pitch."
(continues on next page)

4922085/4850888/4946345.title: Cures for Sore Throats
4922085/4850888/4946345.text:
(continued from previous page)
When one has a sore throat a stocking of hot salt is got when going to bed, and tied around the neck. When one would get up in the morning the sore throat would be gone. (Tom Fitzgerald.)Put salt into an oven and warm it over the fire, then put the warm salt into a woollen stocking and tie it around your neck. (John Mulcahy.)Get a cup of hot water, put a spoon of salt into it, stir it and wait until it is cool, wash your mouth with it then, and the soreness will go away after a few days. (Willie Hayes)



Hang a piece of cloth on a bush on Saint Andrew's night, and when you get the pain tie it around your head. (Chris Humphreys)

4922210/4860887/5015998.text:

LumbagoA mixture of salt and mustard on red flannel



Sore throatWell heated salt in a woollen stocking which is tied round the throat on retiring to bed



A cold1. An onion is boiled in a pint of new milk and drunk as hot as possible. The patient must remain in bed for a day or two2. Bathe the feet in hot water and mustard



Ear-acheA piece of cotton wool steeped in hot olive oil placed in the ear gives relief2. Hold the ear over the stream of a jug of boiling water3. Squeeze a portion of a cut onion, and allow a few drops of the juice into the ear.4. The centre of an onion heated at the fire and inserted in the ear.

Baintrear birtín fraoié sa t-sliabh agus beirightear go maith é. Nuaire fuaireann sé taréis beirighthe faghtar ceirt ghlan anainte agus sgagear tríd, idir firaoch u's uisge, isteach in Arcach glan. 5044849/5044083/5087820.title: Cure against Fever or Ague
5044849/5044083/5087820.text:
The following cure was given me by Patrick Soden Knockanork aged 80 years. He remembers the prayer being given in Irish by a man named Smith to one named Carolan. Carolan knew no Irish & Smith used to repeat in Irish & explain in English.



Prayer.As our saviour came to the place where the Veronia (This may mean Veronica) was to die He shivered & He shook and the Jews asked Him was it through mock was it fever or ague He had. He made answer and said not. Anyone carrying these words about them either in writing or memory shall never be smitten with fever or ague.



Cure of Backache. Only possessed by those born wrong. The patient lies on his back on the floor and the curer walks over the body.

Either the 7th or 9th son has the cure for Lumbago. Mick Larney of Pullafree, Crosskeys, was such a person. When a man came to him to be cured, he placed him lying on his "mouth and nose" on the floor and then stepping on his back for several minutes. Then he would tell him to be off, that he was cured.Larney appeared to take the whole thing as a joke. If you went to him and said, "Here well, down with you", in coming to get down on the floor.He never charged for his cure.

5008960/4971076/5109420.title: Whooping Cough
5008960/4971076/5109420.text:
Whoopen [Whooping] cough:- A very old cure for the whoopen cough[\] in Meath, is to go into a house where two people of the same name are married, and take a cut of bread off the table and tell the two people to take a bite from the (the) bread, and then the sufferer eats the rest. (2) Another old cure in Meath for the Whoopen cough, is, for your grandmother, or your grandfather, to buy you a little strip of re flannen, and tie it around the suffer's neck, and in the end of three days the whoopen will be cured.Seán Ó Cearbhaill.



Stye in the eye:Ten gooseberry dalks are got for to cure a stye in the eye and each are pointed to the eye in the name of the Blessed Trinity.Séumas Ó Ruaire



Cure for sore Breast of Back; The bark of an Oak boiled, and wash sore part

5009044/4980322/5118426.title: Cure for the Rose
5009044/4980322/5118426.text:
The rose is a round red lump or swelling.A bottle of water, a bit of mud from a lake called Lough [unknown] in Meath cures the Rose.A male person has to lift the water for a female, and a female has to lift it for a male.The person who lifts the water is not supposed to look back at the lake after lifting the water until the sufferer is cured.The invalid must give silver to the person who lifts the water.



The person who has the pain in his back has to go to some-one who has the cure. He has to lie down on his mouth and nose and let the person put his two feet on his back and he will get better of the pain.

5008933/4967785/5119890.title: Cure of a Pain in Your Back
5008933/4967785/5119890.text:
In a certain place in West Meath there is a chair. It is supposed to be St. Patrick's chair. If you have a pain in your back it will be cured if you sit on the chair and if you have no pain and sit on the chair you will never have a pain in your back.



There is a man inRathmolyon who cures warts you have to count the warts and give him  a penny for each wart and after nine days the warts will go.

5044638/5028275/5143579.text:
Give dog affected 1 tablet of Reckett's Blue dissolved in a glass of water.Dose may be given when animal is fasting or a few hours after it has taken food.



Wear a skien of black purse silk around the waist.Wear the "D" violin string round the waist & have it worn next the skin.

4798708/4792150/5267391.title: Old Cures - Whooping-Cough
4798708/4792150/5267391.text:
Old curesPeople in olden days had cures for almost every ailment. There was no such thing as a doctor sent for. There was a cure for;Whooping coughThis cure was always tried and was always successful . The child that was suffering from the cough was put in and out three times under a donkeys legs and making the sign of the cross each time.



Pain in the backThis was usually cured by hanging a pit hooks on the back, and making the sign of the cross
